comments.html: So show running-config may be substituted by more tftp://local.ip.addr/system:running-config ?
comments.name: Anonymous

comments.html: Nope, due to TFTP server limitations (or maybe its a 'security' feature) you cannot include the path. So you have to use tftp://local-ip-addr/running-config or tftp://local-ip-addr/startup-config :)
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html:
I'm loading my OSes in my lab that way using the loopback adapter...
didn't want to spend the money on more flash... =)

boot-start-marker
boot system tftp://192.168.201.10/c3620-ik9o3s7-mz.123-23.bin
boot-end-marker
interface Loopback0
ip address 192.168.201.10 255.255.255.255
tftp-server slot0:c3620-ik9o3s7-mz.123-23.bin
comments.name: Tommy B

comments.html:
Is it possible to use internal tftp for serving static-bindings file for dhcp-pool?

Example:
static-bindings is saved on flash (Soho97 in this case), and configuration

tftp-server flash1:static-bindings

(dhcp pool conf.)
origin file tftp://local-ip-addr/static-bindings
comments.name: Anonymous

comments.html: @Anonymous: why would you want to do that? Isn't it simpler to specify origin file flash:static-bindings?
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak
